short_summary: Maintenance thermal equipment of the Regional Food Production Center
description: For the Maintenance thermal equipment of the Regional Food Production Center  The Correctional Service of Canada has a requirement to ensure the proper operation and maintenance of the thermal equipment of its food production center  Objectives: Perform preventive and corrective maintenance of thermal equipment at the regional food production center  Period of the Contract: The Work is to be performed during the period of the award of the standing offer until December 31, 2025 inclusively with the option to renew for two (2) additional one-year periods

full_summary:
### Business Opportunity Notification

**Title:** Maintenance of the thermal equipment at the Regional Food Production Center

**Reference Number:** PW-22-01010837

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open bidding

**Deadline:** December 15, 2022, 2:00 PM EST

**Objective:**

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) at the Sainte-Anne-des-Plaines complex requires a service provider to maintain the thermal equipment at the Regional Food Production Center. The successful vendor will perform preventive and corrective maintenance of the equipment to ensure its proper operation.

**Key Requirements:**

* Perform preventive and corrective maintenance of thermal equipment according to applicable standards
* Document maintenance activities to provide the CSC with technical knowledge of the equipment's condition
* Comply with the terms and conditions of the tender document

**Trade Agreements:**

This tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), as well as the agreements with Chile, Colombia, Honduras, Panama, and Peru.

**Procurement Category:**

This procurement falls under the category of facilities management (SRVTGD).

**Regions of Opportunity:**

This tender is open to suppliers within the province of Quebec (excluding the National Capital Region).

**Attachments:**

The complete tender document, including the statement of work and evaluation criteria, can be downloaded from the Buyandsell.gc.ca website.

**Contact Information:**

* Clement, Karine
* Contracting and Procurement Regional Officer
* Phone: 514-235-8177
* Email: [karine.clement@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:karine.clement@csc-scc.gc.ca)

### Important Notes:

* Bidders may submit their proposals in either English or French.
* After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.
* Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada. Topics include the federal government contracting process, searching for opportunities on the Buy and Sell - Tenders website, and bidding on opportunities.
